meanings.definition: A person who is unwilling to take risks or make a commitment.
meanings.sent1: The piker always avoids trying new things.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a piker, take a chance and see what happens!
meanings.sent3: The piker refused to join the adventure club because of fear of the unknown.
meanings.sent4: She was a piker when it came to love, always hesitant to open her heart.
meanings.sent5: Being a piker in life may lead to missed opportunities and regrets.

meanings.definition: A person who is stingy or unwilling to spend money.
meanings.sent1: My friend is such a piker, he never wants to chip in for anything.
meanings.sent2: Being a piker with your friends can strain relationships over time.
meanings.sent3: The piker held tightly onto his wallet, even when it was for a good cause.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the office piker, always avoiding group lunches.
meanings.sent5: Becoming a piker may save money, but it can also lead to loneliness.

meanings.definition: To act in a cautious or hesitant manner.
meanings.sent1: He tends to piker when it comes to making big decisions.
meanings.sent2: Don't piker around, just go for it!
meanings.sent3: She pikered at the edge of the pool before finally jumping in.
meanings.sent4: The team cannot afford to piker during the final moments of the game.
meanings.sent5: Pikering may sometimes be necessary, but don't let it hold you back from progress.
